body_html:
Lots of progress, in fact! If you upgrade to the nightly build, tf.SparseTensor is now usable wherever tf.Tensor is in all core Dataset operations including Dataset.from_tensors(), Dataset.from_tensor_slices(), Dataset.map(), and Dataset.batch(). The tf.parse_single_example() and tf.parse_example() operations work as normal with sparse and variable-length features.

Thanks for reminding us about this issue... I'm going to mark it as closed, but feel free to reply if there are any remaining difficulties.

(All credit due to @jsimsa.)

body:
Lots of progress, in fact! If you upgrade to the nightly build, `tf.SparseTensor` is now usable wherever `tf.Tensor` is in all core `Dataset` operations including `Dataset.from_tensors()`, `Dataset.from_tensor_slices()`, `Dataset.map()`, and `Dataset.batch()`. The `tf.parse_single_example()` and `tf.parse_example()` operations work as normal with sparse and variable-length features.

Thanks for reminding us about this issue... I'm going to mark it as closed, but feel free to reply if there are any remaining difficulties.

(All credit due to @jsimsa.)
